Topics.Title: Quick Buttons
Topics.Summary: Configure one-click shortcuts for common tasks.
Topics.Content:
Quick Buttons

Quick Buttons provide instant access to frequently used parts and locations.

Using Quick Buttons

Quick Buttons appear on the right side of each tab (Inventory, Remove, Transfer). Click a button to instantly fill in the Part Number and Location fields.

Function Key Shortcuts

Quick Buttons 1-10 are mapped to function keys F1-F10 for keyboard access.

Configuring Quick Buttons

  1. Right-click on a Quick Button.
  2. Select Edit from the context menu.
  3. Enter the Part Number and Location you want to save.
  4. Give it a descriptive name (e.g., 'Warehouse A - Part 123').
  5. Click Save.

Note: Quick Button configurations are saved per user and persist across sessions.

Topics.Title: Grid Customization
Topics.Summary: Customize data grid columns and layout.
Topics.Content:
Grid Customization

You can customize which columns are visible and their order in all data grids.

Column Visibility

  1. Right-click on any grid header row.
  2. A context menu will appear showing all available columns.
  3. Check or uncheck columns to show or hide them.
  4. Changes are automatically saved to your user profile.

Column Reordering

  1. Right-click on the grid header.
  2. Select Change Column Order.
  3. Use the dialog to rearrange columns by dragging them.
  4. Click OK to apply changes.

Quick Actions

  • Select All: Shows all columns.
  • Deselect All: Hides all columns except the first one.

Grid settings are saved automatically when you make changes.
